name: Asymptomatic Testing Center
description: Cabot Physical Education Center was turned into Northeastern's primary testing center, for the university's asymptomatic population. Work included dozens of stations for test administrators and a massive new ventilation system.

name: Symptomatic Testing Center
description: In addition to the main testing center in Cabot, a special testing center for those exhibiting symptoms was also constructed in the Marino Center, in the SASS office.

name: BioE Capstone
description: The BioEngineering Capstone Collaborative was renovated, in anticipation of expansion of the program. The student group spaces in the Richards basement were reprogrammed, with new infrastructure installed. (Renderings: Ellenzweig)

name: Belvidere Place Renovations
description: The College of Professional Studies suite at Belvidere Place sports a new, modern refresh this year.

name: ECE Teaching Classroom
description: This project seeks to optimize the space in Hayden Hall for showcasing College of Engineering teaching classrooms and lab space for Electrical and Computer Engineering. The program includes an updated Capstone Design Studio, larger ECE classrooms, dry labs for microelectronics/sensors and related research,  and maker space to enhance the experience and increase visibility.

name: Fenway Center
description: The Fenway Center has new paths and ramps to make it fully ADA-compliant.

name: Richardson Plaza
description: Richardson Plaza has new green space, seating areas, and electrical and lighting fixtures, breathing new life into the space.

name: Snell Engineering
description: Classrooms 108 and 168 in the Snell Engineering Center have been gut-renovated, updating both the aesthetics of the rooms and the teaching technology inside.

name: outdoor dining tents
description: Five tents, with outdoor furniture, have been installed around the campus to provide ventilated, outdoor space for dining, events, and gatherings, held within the COVID safety guidelines.
